001package gust.backend;
002
003import com.google.common.collect.ImmutableMap;
004import io.micronaut.views.soy.SoyContext;
005import io.micronaut.views.soy.SoyNamingMapProvider;
006import tools.elide.page.Context;
007
008import javax.annotation.Nonnull;
009import javax.annotation.Nullable;
010import javax.annotation.concurrent.Immutable;
011import java.util.Collections;
012import java.util.Map;
013import java.util.Optional;
014
015
016/**
017 * Supplies page context to a Micronaut/Soy render routine, based on the context proto provided/filled out by a given
018 * server-side controller.
019 *
020 * <p>Because this flow occurs in two stages (i.e. building or calculating context, then, subsequently, rendering
021 * context), the logic here is implemented to be entirely immutable, and so this object should be used in a transitory
022 * way to mediate between a single Soy routine and the context attached to it.</p>
023 */
024@Immutable
025@SuppressWarnings("unused")
026public final class PageContext implements PageRender {
027  /** Shared singleton instance of an empty page context. */
028  private static final PageContext _EMPTY = new PageContext(
029    Context.getDefaultInstance(),
030    null,
031    null,
032    null);
033
034  /** Raw context. */
035  private final @Nonnull SoyContext rawContext;
036
037  /** Proto-based context. */
038  private final @Nonnull Context protoContext;
039
040  /**
041   * Private constructor for proto-based page context with an option for additional regular <pre>@param</pre> props, or
042   * additional <pre>@inject</pre> values, and/or an override naming map provider.
043   *
044   * @param proto Context proto to inject with this render operation.
045   * @param context Map of page context information.
046   * @param injected Additional injected properties to apply.
047   * @param namingMapProvider Style rewrite naming provider to apply/override (if enabled).
048   */
049  private PageContext(@Nullable Context proto,
050                      @Nullable Map<String, Object> context,
051                      @Nullable Map<String, Object> injected,
052                      @Nullable SoyNamingMapProvider namingMapProvider) {
053    this.protoContext = proto != null ? proto : Context.getDefaultInstance();
054    this.rawContext = SoyContext.fromMap(
055      context != null ? context : Collections.emptyMap(),
056      injected != null ? Optional.of(injected) : Optional.empty(),
057      namingMapProvider != null ? Optional.of(namingMapProvider) : Optional.empty());
058  }
059
060  // -- Factories: Maps -- //
061
062  /**
063   * Factory to create an empty page context. Under the hood, this uses a static singleton representing an empty context
064   * to avoid re-creating the object repeatedly.
065   *
066   * @return Pre-fabricated empty page context.
067   */
068  public static PageContext empty() {
069    return PageContext._EMPTY;
070  }
071
072  /**
073   * Factory to create a page context object from a regular Java map, of string context properties to values of any
074   * object type. Under the hood, this is processed and converted/wrapped into Soy values.
075   *
076   * @param context Context with which to render a Soy template.
077   * @return Instance of page context, enclosing the provided context.
078   */
079  public static PageContext fromMap(@Nonnull Map<String, Object> context) {
080    return new PageContext(null, context, null, null);
081  }
082
083  /**
084   * Factory to create a page context object from a regular Java map, of string context properties to values of any
085   * object type. Additionally, this interface allows specification of properties declared via <pre>@inject</pre>. Under
086   * the hood, all context is processed and converted/wrapped into Soy values.
087   *
088   * @param context Context with which to render a Soy template - i.e. regular <pre>@param</pre> declarations.
089   * @param injected Injected parameters to provide to the render operation - available via <pre>@inject</pre>.
090   * @return Fabricated page context object.
091   */
092  public static PageContext fromMap(@Nonnull Map<String, Object> context,
093                                    @Nonnull Map<String, Object> injected) {
094    return new PageContext(null, context, injected, null);
095  }
096
097  /**
098   * Factory to create a page context object from a regular Java map, of string context properties to values of any
099   * object type. Additionally, this interface allows specification of properties declared via <pre>@inject</pre>, and
100   * also a {@link SoyNamingMapProvider} to override any globally-installed map. Under the hood, all context is
101   * processed and converted/wrapped into Soy values.
102   *
103   * <p>Note that style rewriting must be enabled for the <pre>namingMapProvider</pre> override to take effect.</p>
104   *
105   * @param context Context with which to render a Soy template - i.e. regular <pre>@param</pre> declarations.
106   * @param injected Injected parameters to provide to the render operation - available via <pre>@inject</pre>.
107   * @param namingMapProvider Override any globally-installed naming map provider.
108   * @return Fabricated page context object.
109   */
110  public static PageContext fromMap(@Nonnull Map<String, Object> context,
111                                    @Nonnull Map<String, Object> injected,
112                                    @Nullable SoyNamingMapProvider namingMapProvider) {
113    return new PageContext(null, context, injected, namingMapProvider);
114  }
115
116  // -- Factories: Protos -- //
117
118  /**
119   * Factory to create a page context object from a proto message containing structured data, which is injected into the
120   * render flow at `context`. Templates may opt-in to receive this value via a parameter declaration such as
121   * <pre>@inject context: gust.page.Context</pre>.
122   *
123   * @param pageContext Protobuf page context.
124   * @return Page context object.
125   */
126  public static @Nonnull PageContext fromProto(@Nonnull Context pageContext) {
127    return new PageContext(pageContext, null, null, null);
128  }
129
130  /**
131   * Factory to create a page context object from a proto message containing structured data, which is injected into the
132   * render flow at `context`. Templates may opt-in to receive this value via a parameter declaration such as
133   * <pre>@inject context: gust.page.Context</pre>.
134   *
135   * <p>This method offers the additional ability to specify <pre>props</pre>, which should correspond with any
136   * <pre>@param</pre> declarations for the subject template to be rendered.</p>
137   *
138   * @param pageContext Protobuf page context.
139   * @param props Parameters to render the template with.
140   * @return Page context object.
141   */
142  public static @Nonnull PageContext fromProto(@Nonnull Context pageContext,
143                                               @Nonnull Map<String, Object> props) {
144    return new PageContext(pageContext, props, null, null);
145  }
146
147  /**
148   * Factory to create a page context object from a proto message containing structured data, which is injected into the
149   * render flow at `context`. Templates may opt-in to receive this value via a parameter declaration such as
150   * <pre>@inject context: gust.page.Context</pre>.
151   *
152   * <p>This method offers the additional ability to specify <pre>props</pre> and <pre>injected</pre> values. Props
153   * should correspond with any <pre>@param</pre> declarations for the subject template to be rendered. Injected values
154   * are opted-into with <pre>@inject</pre>, and are overlaid on any existing injected values (may not override
155   * <pre>context</pre>).</p>
156   *
157   * @param pageContext Protobuf page context.
158   * @param props Parameters to render the template with.
159   * @param injected Additional injected values (may not contain a value at key <pre>context</pre>).
160   * @return Page context object.
161   */
162  public static @Nonnull PageContext fromProto(@Nonnull Context pageContext,
163                                               @Nonnull Map<String, Object> props,
164                                               @Nonnull Map<String, Object> injected) {
165    return new PageContext(pageContext, props, injected, null);
166  }
167
168  /**
169   * Factory to create a page context object from a proto message containing structured data, which is injected into the
170   * render flow at `context`. Templates may opt-in to receive this value via a parameter declaration such as
171   * <pre>@inject context: gust.page.Context</pre>.
172   *
173   * <p>This method offers the additional ability to specify <pre>props</pre> and <pre>injected</pre> values. Props
174   * should correspond with any <pre>@param</pre> declarations for the subject template to be rendered. Injected values
175   * are opted-into with <pre>@inject</pre>, and are overlaid on any existing injected values (may not override
176   * <pre>context</pre>).</p>
177   *
178   * <p>If desired, an invoking developer may wish to specify a <pre>namingMapProvider</pre>. To have any effect, style
179   * renaming must be active in application config. The naming map provider passed here overrides any globally-installed
180   * style renaming map provider.</p>
181   *
182   * @param pageContext Protobuf page context.
183   * @param props Parameters to render the template with.
184   * @param injected Additional injected values (may not contain a value at key <pre>context</pre>).
185   * @param namingMapProvider Naming map provider to override any globally-installed provider with, if enabled.
186   * @return Page context object.
187   */
188  public static @Nonnull PageContext fromProto(@Nonnull Context pageContext,
189                                               @Nonnull Map<String, Object> props,
190                                               @Nonnull Map<String, Object> injected,
191                                               @Nullable SoyNamingMapProvider namingMapProvider) {
192    return new PageContext(pageContext, props, injected, namingMapProvider);
193  }
194
195  // -- Interface: Soy Proto Context -- //
196
197  /**
198   * Retrieve serializable server-side-rendered page context, which should be assigned to the render flow bound to this
199   * context mediator.
200   *
201   * @return Server-side rendered page context.
202   */
203  @Nonnull @Override
204  public Context getPageContext() {
205    return this.protoContext;
206  }
207
208  // -- Interface: Soy Context Mediation -- //
209
210  /**
211   * Retrieve properties which should be made available via regular, declared `@param` statements.
212   *
213   * @return Map of regular template properties.
214   */
215  @Nonnull @Override
216  public Map<String, Object> getProperties() {
217    return rawContext.getProperties();
218  }
219
220  /**
221   * Retrieve properties and values that should be made available via `@inject`.
222   *
223   * @return Map of injected properties and their values.
224   */
225  @Nonnull @Override
226  public Map<String, Object> getInjectedProperties() {
227    return ImmutableMap
228      .<String, Object>builder()
229      .put(PAGE_CONTEXT_IJ_NAME, protoContext)
230      .putAll(rawContext.getInjectedProperties())
231      .build();
232  }
233
234  /**
235   * Specify a Soy renaming map which overrides the globally-installed map, if any. Renaming must still be activated via
236   * config, or manually, for the return value of this method to have any effect.
237   *
238   * @return {@link SoyNamingMapProvider} that should be used for this render routine.
239   */
240  @Nonnull @Override
241  public Optional<SoyNamingMapProvider> overrideNamingMap() {
242    return rawContext.overrideNamingMap();
243  }
244}
